page.title: 02All Saints' Church Hurworth
page.content: There has been a church on this site since the twelfth century.The first rector was John in 1160 A.D.The church was built of local red sandstone and in the nineteenth century was considered unsafe and pulled down.A new church was built in 1832 incorpo- rating the base of the tower and two pillars from the original building. Some carved heads and two prone figures were saved also.In 1872 the chancel and high roof were added and the galleries were removed.This year, 1985, the rear of the church has been altered for use as a church hall.This comprises a large upper room and toilet and lower room with toilet and beverage area.Two rows of pews were removed but no structural changes made so that it can be dismantled,if desired.The cost was Â£63000.
